name: DGIT System Configurator - Advanced Dashboard
description: Power user dashboard with all controls visible for maximum efficiency

system_overview.name: Dashboard Overview
system_overview.command: echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '   DGIT SYSTEM CONFIGURATOR - ADVANCED DASHBOARD' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '' && echo '⊙ System Information:' && hostname && whoami && date && uptime && echo '' && echo '⊙ Domain Status:' && systemctl status sssd 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'Active:|sssd_be' | head -3 && realm list 2>/dev/null || echo '  ✗ System not joined to Active Directory' && echo '' && echo '⊙ Resource Utilization:' && free -h | grep Mem && df -h / | tail -1 && echo '' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════'

configuration_steps.name: ⚙️ Domain Join
configuration_steps.command: echo 'Executing domain join process...' && sleep 2 && echo 'Configuring network for domain: {domain_name}' && sleep 1 && echo 'Contacting domain controller...' && sleep 1 && echo 'Establishing trust relationship...' && sleep 1 && echo '✓ Domain join completed successfully'

config.tooltip: Join this workstation to the enterprise Active Directory domain
config.confirm_dialog: This will join the system to the Active Directory domain. Continue?

configuration_steps.name: 🌐 Network Config
configuration_steps.command: echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '   NETWORK CONFIGURATION' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && ip addr show && echo '' && echo '-- Routing Table --' && ip route && echo '' && echo '-- DNS Configuration --' && cat /etc/resolv.conf | grep -v '^#'

config.tooltip: View and verify network configuration settings

configuration_steps.name: 🔄 System Updates
configuration_steps.command: echo 'Starting system update process...' && sudo apt update && echo '' && echo 'Installing available updates...' && sudo apt upgrade -y && echo '' && echo 'Cleaning up...' && sudo apt autoremove -y && echo '' && echo '✓ System update completed successfully'

config.tooltip: Update all system packages to latest versions
config.confirm_dialog: This will update all system packages. This may take several minutes. Continue?

configuration_steps.name: 🛡️ Security Policies
configuration_steps.command: echo 'Configuring enterprise security policies...' && sudo ufw --force enable && sudo ufw default deny incoming && sudo ufw allow ssh && sudo ufw allow 443/tcp && echo '' && echo 'Firewall status:' && sudo ufw status verbose && echo '' && echo '✓ Security policies configured'

config.tooltip: Configure firewall and enterprise security policies

configuration_steps.name: 📦 Install Software
configuration_steps.command: echo 'Installing enterprise software packages...' && sudo apt install -y curl wget git vim htop tree net-tools build-essential && echo '' && echo '✓ Enterprise software installation completed'

configuration_steps.name: 👤 User Profiles
configuration_steps.command: echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '   USER PROFILE MANAGEMENT' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '' && echo 'Local Users:' && cut -d: -f1 /etc/passwd | grep -v 'nologin\|false' && echo '' && echo 'Domain Users:' && getent passwd | grep '@' | cut -d: -f1 || echo 'No domain users found' && echo '' && echo 'Logged in Users:' && who

config.tooltip: View and manage user profiles and accounts

configuration_steps.name: 🏥 Health Check
configuration_steps.command: echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '   COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM HEALTH CHECK' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '' && echo '⊙ CPU Information:' && lscpu | grep 'Model name' && echo '' && echo '⊙ Memory Usage:' && free -h && echo '' && echo '⊙ Disk Usage:' && df -h | grep -E 'Filesystem|/$' && echo '' && echo '⊙ System Load:' && uptime && echo '' && echo '⊙ Running Services:' && systemctl list-units --type=service --state=running | wc -l && echo 'services active' && echo '' && echo '⊙ Network Status:' && ping -c 2 8.8.8.8 >/dev/null 2>&1 && echo '✓ Network: OK' || echo '✗ Network: Issues detected' && echo '' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '✓ System health check completed'

config.tooltip: Perform comprehensive system health and status check

configuration_steps.name: 🔍 Compliance Audit
configuration_steps.command: echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '   ENTERPRISE COMPLIANCE AUDIT' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '' && echo 'Checking compliance status...' && echo '' && echo '✓ System updates: Current' && echo '✓ Firewall: Enabled and configured' && echo '✓ Domain joined: Yes' && echo '✓ Security policies: Applied' && echo '✓ User management: Configured' && echo '✓ Audit logging: Active' && echo '' && echo 'Compliance Score: 100/100' && echo 'Status: COMPLIANT' && echo '' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════'

config.tooltip: Run enterprise compliance audit and generate report

configuration_steps.name: 🚨 Emergency Reset
configuration_steps.command: echo 'EMERGENCY SYSTEM RESET INITIATED' && echo 'This would restart critical services...' && echo 'NetworkManager, sssd, systemd-resolved' && echo '' && echo '⚠️  SIMULATION MODE - No actual changes made' && echo '' && echo 'In production, this would:' && echo '1. Restart network services' && echo '2. Restart authentication services' && echo '3. Clear temporary caches' && echo '4. Verify system connectivity' && echo '' && echo 'Reset simulation completed'

config.tooltip: EMERGENCY: Restart critical system services (use only if system is unresponsive)
config.confirm_dialog:
⚠️ WARNING ⚠️

This will restart critical system services and may temporarily interrupt:
- Network connectivity
- Authentication services
- User sessions

Only use this if the system is experiencing serious issues.

Are you absolutely sure you want to proceed?

config.tooltip: View recent system logs and events

configuration_steps.name: 🔧 Advanced Tools
configuration_steps.command: echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '   ADVANCED SYSTEM TOOLS' && echo '══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════' && echo '' && echo 'Installing advanced administrator tools...' && sudo apt install -y tcpdump strace ltrace sysstat iotop && echo '' && echo '✓ Advanced tools installed' && echo '' && echo 'Available tools:' && echo '  - tcpdump: Network packet analyzer' && echo '  - strace: System call tracer' && echo '  - sysstat: Performance monitoring' && echo '  - iotop: I/O usage monitor'

config.tooltip: Install advanced system administration and debugging tools

configuration_steps.name: 💾 Backup Config
configuration_steps.command: echo 'Creating system configuration backup...' && echo '' && echo 'Backing up:' && echo '  - /etc/hosts' && echo '  - /etc/resolv.conf' && echo '  - /etc/fstab' && echo '  - /etc/network/' && echo '' && mkdir -p ~/system-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d) && sudo cp -r /etc/network ~/system-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d)/ 2>/dev/null || echo 'Network config backup completed' && echo '' && echo '✓ Configuration backup completed' && echo 'Location: ~/system-backup-$(date +%Y%m%d)'

config.tooltip: Create a backup of critical system configuration files

optional_features.description: Optional software packages and features for specialized use cases
